result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric G. Kaster
Current: 1232A Minnesota Ave., South Milwaukee, WI 53172 United States  (Effective: 12-08-2016)
Prior: 1213 Menomonee Avenue, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
Defendant Eric G. Kaster in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant Eric G. Kaster in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric G. Kaster in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by atty Nepomiachi denied. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 15GF538 (15-2417 thru 15-2422) and 15CM231
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH T.R.R. 2084 LILY STREET APT 7 EAST TROY. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant in court in custody with attorney Schwantes and intern D. Malkus. Valerian Powell w/ intern M. Fagan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by attorney Malkus granted. Minutes filed.
